The appointee will coordinate projects that focus on swallowing therapy for nasopharyngeal cancer patients. We are the physiotherapy group in Hong Kong specializing in work, orthopaedics and sports rehabilitation. We are looking for experienced full time physiotherapist to provide quality services to our patients. In addition, we are selected as training clinics for physiotherapy students in Hong Kong. Staff will be expected to provide student supervisions if needed.  

Physiotherapist with satisfactory performance would be promoted to be the clinic manager or Group Director. 

Salary package with attractive remuneration will be provided according to the experience of the candidate. Applicant must be mature, self motivated, outgoing and have good personal communication skill and want to develop their career in private practice setting.

description:
Work type: Full-time
Department: LKS Faculty of Medicine - HKU Health System (00105)
Categories: Professional & Management

Applications are invited for appointment as Department Manager (Diagnostic Radiology) to be seconded to The University of Hong Kong (Shenzhen) Teaching Hospital Limited (THL) and assigned to work in the HKU-Shenzhen Hospital (Ref.: 508854), to commence as soon as possible, on a three-year fixed-term basis, with the possibility of renewal.

The University of Hong Kong (HKU) has been collaborating with Shenzhen Government to develop the HKU-Shenzhen Hospital as a teaching hospital of HKU. With the presence of HKU, a new operation model for the Hospital has been introduced, aiming at providing high-quality services from primary to tertiary levels to patients in the region, whilst sustaining a teaching and training mission well supported by a robust research component. The Hospital has commenced operation since October 2012. As the Hospital is located in Shenzhen, travelling to Mainland China is required.

Applicants should possess a Bachelor’s degree and/or a professional qualification in Diagnostic Radiology, preferably with relevant qualifications in special imaging modalities, valid registration and practicing certificates issued by the Radiographers Board in Hong Kong, and at least 5 years’ experience working at senior levels in major hospitals. They should also have:

sound technology knowledge and management experience in planning and implementing diagnostic and special imaging services;
solid experience in procurement, commissioning and management of medical equipment for use in the clinical specialty of diagnostic radiology/nuclear medicine;
substantial expertise and experience in the introduction and use of relevant enabling technologies and systems, such as radiology appointment and reporting system, PAS and filmless radiography systems, to enhance the operational efficiency and effectiveness of diagnostic radiology services;
excellent interpersonal and communication skills; and
a good command of written and spoken English and Chinese, preferably with fluency in Putonghua.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits. The appointment will attract a contract-end gratuity and University contribution to a retirement benefits scheme, totalling up to 15% of basic salary.

The University only accepts online application for the above post. Applicants should apply online and upload an up-to-date C.V[via APPLY NOW].  Review of applications will start as soon as possible and continue until January 31, 2022, or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier.

Advertised:Nov 4, 2021 (HK Time)
Applications close:Jan 31, 2022 (HK Time)
selling_points: 5 years’ experience working at senior levels
travelling to Mainland China is required

SPOT is an interdisciplinary children's therapy centre offering speech, physio, occupational therapy, counselling as well as psychology services.  All SPOT therapists are caring, competent, fully qualified and committed to continuing professional development. Our practice offers an understanding-based, child-centred and family-focused atmosphere. Services are developmental, meaningful and fun. Through creative activities, we meet each child’s individual needs.
SPOT encourages children to grow, learn, explore and develop positive self-esteem. SPOT is located in Central and in Wong Chuk Hang, Hong Kong. The centre has purpose-built motor therapy rooms for children to participate in sensory and group activities, as well as customised private rooms for individual sessions.

Each child is a unique complex individual, with strengths and challenges, who deserves to be treated as such.  We focus on a dynamic, systems, team approach in treating the WHOLE CHILD. 


Occupational Therapists- Mandarin Speaking  
(Full Time or Part-Time)
Location: Hong Kong - SPOT Centres in Central and Wong Chuk Hang/ Aberdeen + Schools
Website: http://www.spot.com.hk

Job Description:
We are looking to recruit HK registered, qualified therapists, to join our innovative and dynamic multi-disciplinary team to provide Occupational Therapy. Duties include but are not limited to:

Provision of 1:1 and group therapy
Assessment 
A comprehensive report and letter writing
Documentation of client contact, goal setting, treatment planning and intervention
Working within a multi-professional team and liaising with relevant external agencies
Adherence to SPOT policies and procedures
Active participation in team communication, networking and support
Continuing professional development.
Therapists will be expected to show sound clinical reasoning skills, utilising evidenced-based practice for children with developmental, medical, neurological, functional, sensory and/or motor disorders, mental health challenges and/or specific learning differences.

You will be joining a team of speech and language therapists, occupational therapists, physiotherapists, psychologists and counsellors with a wide range of clinical expertise, offering many opportunities to enhance your skills and knowledge. 

Personal Qualities:

Flexibility, initiative, ability to work alone and as part of a team, motivation to pursue continued professional development.
Comfortable working with children and with special needs, understanding and accepting of a diverse range of strengths, abilities and challenges. 
Committed and passionate about personal professional development and advancing child development provision and practice in Hong Kong.

Requirements:

Internationally recognised degree in Occupational Therapy

Excellent interpersonal and communication skills and command of the English language.
Fluent written and spoken Cantonese/ Mandarin
Minimum of 2 years of paediatric experience. 
Experience in managing a diverse caseload, assessment and interpretation of standardised tests, goal setting, treatment planning and intervention.
Speciality training in paediatric areas is highly regarded. (specifically Ayres Sensory Integration / SOS Feeding Therapy / Beckman Oral Motor / Specific Learning Differences / Infant and Child Mental Health / Adoption).

Salary Range: $45,000 - $70,000 HKD per month.

Start Date: ASAP


Please send your CV and expression of interest.

Behavioral Therapists will implement treatment programs locally and overseas, observe and record children’s behaviors, monitor student progress, participate in clinics and team meetings, and receive pre-service and ongoing training from Program Supervisors and Consultants.  We are looking for people with:

Enthusiasm, willingness to learn, and commitment
A creative thinker with strong critical thinking skills and problem solving skills
The ability to work independently as well as part of a team

Evangelical Lutheran Church Social Service – Hong Kong (ELCSS-HK), one of the largest NGOs in Hong Kong, was established in 1976. With an innovative, caring and people-oriented approach, we provide integrated services to the grassroots and the disadvantaged.

job_title: ABA Therapist for Children with Autism (5 days work)
description:
ABA Therapist for Children with Autism (5 days work)

Autism Partnership Foundation (APF) formed in 2007 is committed to making a difference in the life of individuals with autism. Our Parent Resource Centre mainly conduct sessions in a one-on-one format most of time, and small-group teaching and/or structured playdates at different stages.

In addition, Autism Partnership Foundation (APF)also operate Aoi Pui School (APS) located in Hung Hom which is the first private charitable school formally registered at the EDB and provides Autism-specific education to the affected population.

We employed over 60 therapists/ supervisors/ consultants to provide quality ABA service to autism students and we are continuing to grow, thus we are looking for Creative, Enthusiastic, Fun and patience people to join our team as an ABA Therapist for Children with Autism.  

We provide an Intensive (240 hours) High Quality ABA training in the form of didactic and practical hands-on training, aim to equip staff as a professional ABA Therapist. 

We are focusing on:

Language & Communication
Social skills including initiation & assertiveness
Behavioral management & Compliance problems
Creative and Imaginary Play Skills
Abstract and Creative thinking
General Knowledge
Community Training & Vocational skills
Emotional Regulation
Organizational Skills
Perspective Taking


Applicants should be :

Highly passionate towards children
Bilingual in Cantonese and English
Degree holder
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Energetic and outgoing
Please send cover letter with full CV with your expected package and availability (MUST include)

description:
THE JOB

Reporting to the Senior Sport Physiotherapist, the Physiotherapist will be responsible for the following duties: 

To provide physiotherapy treatment and rehabilitation services for scholarship athletes including Para athletes, and to provide overseas on-field support;
To liaise with coaches, sports medicine professionals, sports scientist, strength and conditioning coaches and related personnel on athletes’ rehabilitation, injury management, and the planning of injury prevention programmes; 
To plan and conduct sports medicine related research, educational programmes for athletes and coaches; and
To perform any other appropriate duties as assigned by supervisor.

THE REQUIREMENTS



A university degree in physiotherapy or a relevant discipline, preferably a master degree in sports physiotherapy or musculoskeletal physiotherapy
Must be registered by the Hong Kong Physiotherapy Board, with a minimum of 2 years’ physiotherapy or sports relevant working experience;
Experience in managing sports injury, experience in working with Para athletes is a definite advantage;
Excellent command of both spoken and written English and Chinese. Ability to speak Putonghua is a definite advantage; and
Awareness/ knowledge of Child Protection in sport and equal opportunity issues in the context of Hong Kong are an added advantage.
